citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC approved protocol indicates that animals could be expected to experience loss of up to 10% body weight while
enrolled on procedures that include food scheduling. On review of records at the time of inspection, it was discovered that
one animal had lost 13% of its body weight as of June 2nd, 2023 while enrolled on a food scheduled procedure under this
protocol. The attending veterinarian was not notified and the animal was maintained on study.
Deviation from the monitoring parameters described in the protocol can compromise the ability of research and veterinary
personnel to respond to potential problems of animal health and wellbeing and constitutes a significant change that did
not undergo IACUC review and approval.
Any activity involving the care and use of animals must be conducted as approved by the IACUC, and any significant
change in ongoing activities regarding the care and use of animals must be reviewed and approved by the IACUC prior to
being instituted.
To be corrected from September 1st, 2023 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
